cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi (200 km) ESE of Barbuda
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest through early Tuesday, then turning north-northwest late Tuesday and north on Wednesday, passing near or just northeast of the northern Leeward Islands and then accelerating northward toward the western Atlantic (south of Bermuda).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct landfall – center forecast to skirt just northeast of the northern Leeward Islands (near Barbuda/Antigua) late 02 Oct

weather_observation.watch_coast: Antigua and Barbuda under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands (Antigua, Barbuda and adjacent islands); swells also impacting Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico coastlines
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts are unlikely; sustained winds generally below 25–30 mph with highest gusts Monday night–Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; however, long-period swells will create rough surf and rip currents.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy showers possible Monday night through Tuesday with local totals 1–2 inches; isolated street flooding in poor-drainage areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf along east-facing beaches beginning Monday and persisting into Wednesday.
